page.title: 03MORTHAM ESTATE
page.content: Mortham Estate is a family trust, consisting of the manors of Rokeby, Mortham and Brignall. It extends to about 3500 acres and there are twelve separate agricultural tenancies. In common with all such estates, the type of farming has changed. Mechanisation and some degree of specialisation, have meant the number of people working on the farms has decreased. Many cottages, originally for farm workers, have either fallen into decay or are used for other purposes. Many farm buildings are no longer suitable for modern machinery. The typical farm has perhaps three tractors, combine harvester, silage maker, and perhaps two large custom-built buildings fo dairy, grain or food storage and beef rearing. Its 200 or so acres will employ two men.
